image.altText: A tight shot of Jim Chalmers head, he wears a suit and red tie stands in front of a blue curtain

items.synopsis: Up to $500 in assistance will go to millions of households to help pay energy bills as part of a wide-ranging cost of living package in next week's federal budget.

title.children: Millions to receive up to $500 in energy bill relief at federal budget, as Treasurer flags broader cost of living support

image.altText: Charlotte and Louis whisper and point in the Abbey. Seated either side of them, Wills and Kate read programs

items.synopsis: The highly anticipated "slimmed-down" coronation of King Charles III is over. Missed it? Here's how it unfolded.

title.children: From Louis's antics to a furrowed brow on the balcony: The key moments of the coronation

image.altText: A middle-aged white man sitting in a dark room with a lamp on

items.synopsis: As the cost-of-living crisis continues, Australians are having to change the way they live. But for some households, there's nowhere left to cut back.

title.children: As the cost-of-living crisis drags on, exhausted low-income earners are finding fewer and fewer ways to cut back

image.altText: A Wests Tigers NRL player grounds the ball over the tryline near the corner flag as a Dragons defender grabs him by the leg.

items.synopsis: Two more Queensland teams are in action on the final day of Magic Round, but first the Tigers and Dragons face off. Follow our ScoreCentre for all the live scores and stats.

title.children: NRL live: Tigers in front of Dragons in scrappy opening to last day of Magic Round

image.altText: Beth Schwalb Anglicare

items.synopsis: From revisiting household budgets to talking to the bank, experts share how mortgage holders can navigate interest rate rises.

title.children: What financial counsellors tell people struggling with rising interest rates to do

image.altText: King Charles III and Queen Camilla on the balcony of Buckingham Palace following

items.synopsis: The narrative of Camilla Parker Bowles's transformation from pariah to Queen Consort reached its zenith yesterday when, in front of the whole world, the greatest love of King Charles's life was anointed with holy oil and consecrated, writes Juliet Rieden.

title.children: The moment it was decided that Camilla would be 'Queen'

image.altText: Bearded man in a hat and glasses smoking a joint.

items.synopsis: There is always something in the air around Nimbin during the annual Mardi Grass Festival, but this year it's combined with a sense of optimism.

title.children: Michael's medical weed is legal, but he's at Nimbin's Mardi Grass Festival to push for further cannabis reform

image.altText: A side profile of Ms Hudson, with a minuture Qantas plane tail blurred in the foreground.

items.synopsis: Two Qantas veterans – an accountant and a pilot – represent the two modern faces of the airline and the battle for its future. Can new boss Vanessa Hudson win staff's trust and customer loyalty after a bumpy few years?

title.children: Can the new Qantas boss undo the damage to the airline's reputation?

image.altText: Members of the coronation procession can be seen riding past on a coach with people holding Not My King signs in the background

items.synopsis: London Metropolitan Police arrest the leader of an anti-monarchy group and 51 other protesters at King Charles III's coronation, saying their duty to prevent disruption outweighed the right to protest.

title.children: 'Disgusting and massively over the top': London police arrest 52 protesters during King Charles's coronation

image.altText: People are pictured walking towards a police car with their hands up.

items.synopsis: A gunman shoots multiple people at an outlet mall in the Dallas suburb of Allen, Texas, killing at least eight and sending hundreds of shoppers fleeing in panic.

title.children: At least eight killed and seven wounded in shopping centre shooting near Dallas, Texas

image.altText: Smoke and flames rise as a vehicles and a building burn.

items.synopsis: The death toll after ethnic clashes in India's remote north-east rises to 54, as authorities issue shoot-at-sight orders in "extreme cases" in an effort to contain the unrest.

title.children: Shoot-at-sight orders issued for 'extreme cases' in India's Manipur as death toll from ethnic clashes reaches 54

image.altText: A pensive man sits without a shirt, wears a hat, surrounded by flood and mud damaged statues, lamp shades, looks away.

items.synopsis: In the midst of trauma, the most unlikely healing tool has come in the form of a camera.

title.children: Flood survivors were 'suspicious' of having their trauma photographed. Then they opened their homes

image.altText: A young man in green polo shirt smiles next to a woman wearing black and holding a glass of champagne

items.synopsis: Charlie Bradley, a 28-year-old Sydney real estate agent, died a few hours after drinking at a beach club in Canggu. Now that his body is on its way home, his family hope an autopsy may finally reveal some answers as to his final moments.

title.children: Charlie Bradley collapsed outside a Bali medical clinic. By the time he reached hospital, he was already dead

image.altText: A boy in a red jacket next to a woman with a crown on her head

items.synopsis: Formerly the queen consort, Camilla also went through similar ceremonial procedures to the King, leaving Westminster Abbey with a new title. So why did Camilla become Queen, and why was Prince Philip never king? Here's what you need to know.

title.children: Camilla's title is changing to Queen, but Prince Philip never got to be king. Here's why

image.altText: A group of people stand together looking at the camera. Some of the men are shirtless.

items.synopsis: After thousands of people were taken from islands in the Pacific in the 19th century and brought to Australia to work, their only link home was storytelling and song — now, with the rise of social media and affordable travel, their descendants are working to reunite families that were torn apart.

title.children: Generations ago, families were ripped apart in the Pacific. Now, these women are working to reunite them

image.altText: A smiling woman with child

items.synopsis: The rising cost of living is exacerbating the foster carer shortage in regional communities, prompting calls for government to increase the carer allowance.

title.children: Sophie adores being a foster carer, but the rising cost of living is making it tougher by the day

image.altText: Jade wears a helmet and safety vest while holding Queenie, who has a blue halter.

items.synopsis: The demand for mental health support in regional Victoria is rising after last year's floods. A unique counselling service near one of the hardest hit towns is pleading for donations to expand its service.

title.children: Demand soars for therapy program where horses and people help each other

image.altText: A woman smiling, couched beside a 12 year old boy in a wheelchair.

items.synopsis: Parents of a Bendigo boy have spent years trying to understand their son's rare degenerative condition called KAND, but a new research trial could help provide him with a treatment.

title.children: Edward has a rare degenerative condition. His parents hope a US research trial will produce a treatment

image.altText: Britain's Prince Harry walks outside Westminster Abbey.

items.synopsis: King Charles appeared on the balcony of Buckingham Palace with his wife Queen Camilla, heir to the throne Prince William and other senior royals but Prince Harry was absent.

title.children: Harry exits as King Charles and senior royals wave to thousands on Buckingham Palace balcony

image.altText: sword, charles with crown, spurs

items.synopsis: Although more restrained than some of his predecessors, King Charles III's coronation was still a lavish display of royal wealth.

title.children: How much did King Charles's coronation cost and which royal jewels were featured?

image.altText: Tight headshot of Queensland police commissioner Terry Lewis speaking to the media in Brisbane in the 1980s.

items.synopsis: The first serving Australian police commissioner to be knighted was jailed in 1991 for official corruption after being named in the Fitzgerald Inquiry.

title.children: 'He was an evil man': Whistleblower says former police commissioner Terry Lewis 'perverted the job'

image.altText: A young man smiles at the camera in a black and white image taken in a busy indoor location.

items.synopsis: University student Alex Shorey, who unknowingly ingested rat poison in Taiwan, thanks everyone responsible for helping him return to Australia, as he continues to recover in hospital.

title.children: Australian Alex Shorey speaks from hospital after ingesting rat poison in Taiwan

image.altText: Bodhi Mani Risby-Jones paraded by Indonesian authorities in balaclava and jumpsuit

items.synopsis: Bodhi Mani Risby-Jones apologises in a press conference for attacking a man badly enough to hospitalise him and for "the embarrassment I've caused".

title.children: Australian admits to rampage in Indonesia after being paraded in prison jumpsuit

image.altText: A group of swimmers on a pontoon at sunrise.

items.synopsis: A growing number of swimmers are taking to ocean rock pools across regional Western Australia to bond with like-minded souls and brave plunging water temperatures for an early-morning dip.

title.children: Ocean swimmers lapping late-risers to enjoy exercise, social connection in coastal WA

image.altText: A collation of several brands and logos.

items.synopsis: From jeans to baseball teams, the AFL has an interesting history of battling for trademarks — but the fight for the Devils might be the most intriguing of all, writes Cody Atkinson and Sean Lawson.

title.children: Levi Strauss, baseball and history repeating — inside the AFL's trademark battle for the Devils

image.altText: A man in a black t-shirt poses for a photo in front of masses of tall cacti

items.synopsis: In Sydney, a hidden group of gardeners tend backyards brimming with cactus varieties, consuming the produce. I tracked them down to try and understand the allure – and danger – of psychoactive plants, writes Prudence Gibson.

title.children: The delights and dangers of Sydney's secret psychoactive cacti growers

image.altText: Nikki stands next to a mannequin and tape measure

items.synopsis: After sending her works down some of the country's biggest catwalks, Nikki Hind is fighting for the next generation's right to dream.

title.children: This designer thinks you don't need vision to appreciate fashion

image.altText: A plane flying overhead

items.synopsis: With port and rail infrastructure already in place, the project to create environmentally cleaner aviation fuel will be based in north Queensland.

title.children: Sustainable aviation fuel to be produced in sugarcane country

image.altText: Glass of orange juice with oranges

items.synopsis: The global futures price for frozen orange juice concentrate has hit a record high in 2023, mostly because of production issues in the major citrus-growing US state of Florida.

title.children: US records its smallest orange crop since the 1930s. What does this mean for Australia?

image.altText: Swimmer Katja Dedekind takes off her cap after getting out of the pool.

items.synopsis: Katja Dedekind had her first period at nine years old and has struggled with chronic pain ever since, due to endometriosis. She doesn't want others suffering in silence like she did.

title.children: After Katja Dedekind broke a world record, the Paralympic swimmer was bedridden

image.altText: A man in a suit and tie.

items.synopsis: Opposition Leader Peter Dutton now faces another by-election just weeks after defeat in the Melbourne seat of Aston.

title.children: Stuart Robert announces intention to retire from federal politics

image.altText: Attendees light candles at a vigil for Md Isfaqur Rahman.

items.synopsis: Darwin's Bangladeshi community continues to band together after the death of 23-year-old university student Md Isfaqur Rahman, who was killed during an alleged violent home invasion during the week.

title.children: 'We have no words': Darwin international student community mourns death of Md Isfaqur Rahman

image.altText: an older Indigenous woman holds a Gija dictionary

items.synopsis: Gija people are known across Australia and globally for their striking artwork. Now, after decades of painstaking work, the beauty of their language is there for all to read.

title.children: Naughty words, nasal sounds and vast landscapes: Gija language immortalised in dictionary

image.altText: An Australian flag flies in front of a beautiful coastal view

items.synopsis: A years-long dispute about the location of a flagpole involving a state politician, her neighbour and the local shire has cost Esperance ratepayers more than $20,000.

title.children: The flagpole, the Labor MLC, her neighbour and the $20k legal bill

image.altText: Ruva Ngwenya, a 30-year-old Black woman with braided hair, wears a black leather jacket and hoop earrings before a pink backdrop

items.synopsis: Ruva Ngwenya has been performing in musicals for 10 years but Tina – the Tina Turner Musical will be the first time she’s playing a lead role, and it’s one that has been 15 years in the making.

title.children: A Tina Turner banger changed Ruva's life and now she gets to sing it eight times a week
